The starting materials and solvents were purchased from commercial sources (analytical reagent grade) and used without further purification.</ce:para><ce:section-title id="st020">Preparations</ce:section-title><ce:section-title id="st025">Syntheses of [Fe(abpt)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(μ-M(CN)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)] (M<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Pt<ce:sup loc="post">II</ce:sup> (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>), Ni<ce:sup loc="post">II</ce:sup> (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>))</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0025" view="all">An ethanolic solution (10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) of abpt (95.3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.4<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) was added progressively, under continuous stirring, to 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL of a 1:1 water/methanol solution containing Fe(BF<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (67.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and the corresponding salt of K<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>[M(CN)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>] (M<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Pt<ce:sup loc="post">II</ce:sup> (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>): 75.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol; M<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Ni<ce:sup loc="post">II</ce:sup> (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>): 48.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol). For both compounds <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> and <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>, the resulting red-orange precipitate was filtered off, washed with water and ethanol and then dried. [Fe(abpt)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(Pt(CN)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)] (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>). Yield: 130<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 78%. <ce:italic>Anal.</ce:italic> Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">28</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">20</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">16</ce:inf>FePt: C, 40.4; H, 2.4; N, 26.9. Found: C, 40.2; H, 2.3; N, 27.1%. IR (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3225(br), 3179(m), 3142(m), 3079(m), 3051(m), 3019(w), 2164(m), 2132(s), 1633(s), 1609(m), 1588(s), 1568(m), 1541(w), 1521(w), 1490(m), 1461(s), 1426(s), 1402(m), 1340(w), 1301(w), 1289(w), 1276(w), 1256(m), 1167(w), 1147(m), 1116(m), 1082(s), 1057(s), 1038(s), 997(m), 907(w), 894(w), 792(s), 782(s), 755(s), 744(s), 742 (s), 714(w), 693(s), 640(m), 614(m), 526(w), 509(m), 482(m), 451(m). [Fe(abpt)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(Ni(CN)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)] (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>). Yield: 103.0<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 74%. <ce:italic>Anal.</ce:italic> Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">28</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">20</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">16</ce:inf>FeNi: C, 48.4; H, 2.9; N, 32.2. Found: C, 47.8; H, 2.6; N, 32.7%. IR (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3237(br), 3178(m), 3080(m), 3054(m), 3019(w), 2151(m), 2121(s), 2082(w), 1631(s), 1609(m), 1589(s), 1569(m), 1541(w), 1523(w), 1492(m), 1462(s), 1428(s), 1402(m), 1340(w), 1302(w), 1290(w), 1278(w), 1258(m), 1157(m), 1147(m), 1117(m), 1085(s), 1058(s), 1039(s), 998(m), 910(w), 895(w), 797(s), 784(s), 757(s), 745(s), 729 (w), 714(w), 694(s), 641(m), 615(m), 532(w), 493(w), 468(m), 455(m).</ce:para><ce:section-title id="st030">Single-crystals preparation of [Fe(abpt)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(μ-Pt(CN)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)] (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0030" view="all">Single-crystals of compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> were synthesized using gel diffusion technique. The gel phase was obtained by addition of tetramethoxysilane (1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) to an aqueous solution (9<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) of K<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>[Pt(CN)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)] (0.15<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol, 56.6<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg) with stirring; the gel was formed from the resulting solution after a few hours. Then, 6<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL of a 1:1 water/ethanol solution of FeSO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>·7H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.15<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol, 41.7<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg) and abpt ligand (0.33<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol, 78.6<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg) were carefully layered onto the gel. Single-crystals of compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> suitable for X-ray analysis were formed within 2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>weeks. The IR spectrum of the red single crystals of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> formed within the gel is identical to that observed for the red powder of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> (see Section ). Attempts to prepare single crystals of nickel analogue (compound <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>) led us to only polycrystalline powder for which the IR spectrum is similar to that described above for this compound (see Section ).</ce:para>
clean_text:
Experimental

General remarks

All reactions were carried out under aerobic conditions. The starting materials and solvents were purchased from commercial sources (analytical reagent grade) and used without further purification.

Preparations

Syntheses of [Fe(abpt)2(μ-M(CN)4)] (M=PtII (1), NiII (2))

An ethanolic solution (10mL) of abpt (95.3mg, 0.4mmol) was added progressively, under continuous stirring, to 10mL of a 1:1 water/methanol solution containing Fe(BF4)2⋅6H2O (67.5mg, 0.2mmol) and the corresponding salt of K2[M(CN)4] (M=PtII (1): 75.5mg, 0.2mmol; M=NiII (2): 48.2mg, 0.2mmol). For both compounds 1 and 2, the resulting red-orange precipitate was filtered off, washed with water and ethanol and then dried. [Fe(abpt)2(Pt(CN)4)] (1). Yield: 130mg, 78%. Anal. Calc. for C28H20N16FePt: C, 40.4; H, 2.4; N, 26.9. Found: C, 40.2; H, 2.3; N, 27.1%. IR (cm-1): 3225(br), 3179(m), 3142(m), 3079(m), 3051(m), 3019(w), 2164(m), 2132(s), 1633(s), 1609(m), 1588(s), 1568(m), 1541(w), 1521(w), 1490(m), 1461(s), 1426(s), 1402(m), 1340(w), 1301(w), 1289(w), 1276(w), 1256(m), 1167(w), 1147(m), 1116(m), 1082(s), 1057(s), 1038(s), 997(m), 907(w), 894(w), 792(s), 782(s), 755(s), 744(s), 742 (s), 714(w), 693(s), 640(m), 614(m), 526(w), 509(m), 482(m), 451(m). [Fe(abpt)2(Ni(CN)4)] (2). Yield: 103.0mg, 74%. Anal. Calc. for C28H20N16FeNi: C, 48.4; H, 2.9; N, 32.2. Found: C, 47.8; H, 2.6; N, 32.7%. IR (cm-1): 3237(br), 3178(m), 3080(m), 3054(m), 3019(w), 2151(m), 2121(s), 2082(w), 1631(s), 1609(m), 1589(s), 1569(m), 1541(w), 1523(w), 1492(m), 1462(s), 1428(s), 1402(m), 1340(w), 1302(w), 1290(w), 1278(w), 1258(m), 1157(m), 1147(m), 1117(m), 1085(s), 1058(s), 1039(s), 998(m), 910(w), 895(w), 797(s), 784(s), 757(s), 745(s), 729 (w), 714(w), 694(s), 641(m), 615(m), 532(w), 493(w), 468(m), 455(m).

Single-crystals preparation of [Fe(abpt)2(μ-Pt(CN)4)] (1)

Single-crystals of compound 1 were synthesized using gel diffusion technique. The gel phase was obtained by addition of tetramethoxysilane (1mL) to an aqueous solution (9mL) of K2[Pt(CN)4)] (0.15mmol, 56.6mg) with stirring; the gel was formed from the resulting solution after a few hours. Then, 6mL of a 1:1 water/ethanol solution of FeSO4⋅7H2O (0.15mmol, 41.7mg) and abpt ligand (0.33mmol, 78.6mg) were carefully layered onto the gel. Single-crystals of compound 1 suitable for X-ray analysis were formed within 2weeks. The IR spectrum of the red single crystals of 1 formed within the gel is identical to that observed for the red powder of 1 (see Section ). Attempts to prepare single crystals of nickel analogue (compound 2) led us to only polycrystalline powder for which the IR spectrum is similar to that described above for this compound (see Section ).
